content: Dennis is going to CA May 7 - May 12. I am staying home, lol. He is going to visit his parents and kids. I am not going, cause, well, I don't want to. I don't sleep well anymore, plus we got all these animals to take care of. So, I am going to shampoo the carpet and re-arrange the furniture, lol. Anyway, back to the thread,,,,, Dennis said he might carry his gas mask with him to fly out there. I told him, he just might go to jail too for wearing it. Then he said, he will get a small mask at walmart, the kind painters wear. I hope he doesn't get sick though.

content: Yes, I can - and I bet he won't be the only one! Two confirmed cases in San Antonio, so ... What worries me is that I have a Squad Leader TDY in San Antonio for two weeks who will be returning to Germany - after being in a hotel for two weeks with all sorts of exposure, not to mention the River Walk and other places that are MUST SEE in SA/Ft. Sam. It's the speed of international travel these days that gets us into this sort of pickle. Several hours in an aluminum tube breathing recycled air that has already been breathed by everyone else on the plane ... EW! And I'm going back to DC for a TDY in mid-May, so I'm sort of stuck, too. Back in the days of SARS, I did a fair amount of international traveling, and always had to fill out a questionnaire about health status upon landing. I don't know how successful it was, since it was easy to lie and who would know? but SARS never became the pandemic some predicted. Even so, SOME illness WILL become pandemic sooner or later.

content: "Regular" flu kills about 20,000 annually. We have 45 cases of this strain of flu. Something to watch, but there will be more hype then anything with this flu. Remember news outlets are about ratings, not facts.

content: Our number two granddaughter is at Lackland in AF BMT with graduation Memorial Day weekend which might be one of the safer places to be in southern TX at this time. We have reservations to be there for her graduation and unless they publish a travel alert say don't come, we'll be there. BTW, She talked to her mom this past weekend and she's loving basic. A very proud dad and grandpa. God and the soldier, All men adore, In time of trouble, And no more; For when war is over, And all things righted, God is neglected - The old soldier slighted.
